governance.chain: L0 Human → L1 LDS Kernel V1 → L2 Proposer

core.name: TradeOS
core.description: Complete field service management built on LDS streaming architecture. Intelligence lives in data, not models.

principles: Stateless UI shell - buttons, forms, display only
On-demand loading - only current screen entities in memory
L1 Kernel validation - CHECK-THEN-ACT on every action
Deterministic boundaries - same input = same output
architecture.data_flow: User Action → L1 Kernel Check → If ALLOWED → Load Entity → Render → Execute

build_sequence.name: FOUNDATION
build_sequence.description: Core kernel, role boundaries, app shell, authentication

build_sequence.name: CORE_OPERATIONS
build_sequence.description: Dashboard KPIs, calendar, dispatch center, job management

differentiation.vs_servicetitan: Simple pricing, fast onboarding, human support
differentiation.vs_jobber: Real routing with streets, double-booking alerts, better reporting
differentiation.vs_housecall_pro: Human support always, bundled invoice PDFs, easy cancellation
differentiation.vs_buildertrend: Affordable for small teams, mobile-first, data export
differentiation.core_advantage: LDS streaming = instant validation, deterministic behavior, full audit trail

per_chat_protocol: 2. Build entities for ONE phase only
3. Each entity is self-contained with full component code
5. Start new chat for next phase
assembly_protocol: 1. After all phases complete, create TRADEOS_ASSEMBLER.lds.json
2. Assembler combines all entities into single deployable React app
3. Final output: index.html with embedded React + all components
